definition: to approach/to press in
variant of 迫[po4]/to persecute/to oppress/embarrassed
to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing
near/close to/approximately

sentences.english: Bandits, Aproaching the musicians' in the village.
Now that future looms before us.
sentences.chinese: 既然未来正向我们迫近。

sentences.english: These nouns denote consternation that something untoward may be impending.
sentences.chinese: 这些名词意指对某些迫近的不吉之事的焦虑。

sentences.english: The crowd slowly gave way before the policeman.
sentences.chinese: 警察迫近时，那群人便慢慢退后。

sentences.english: The king convoke parliament to cope with the impending danger.
sentences.chinese: 国王召开国会以应付迫近眉睫的危险。

sentences.english: Detroit will keep watch over its shoulder for China’s imminent move onto American home turf.
sentences.chinese: 底特律持续关注着中国汽车工业即将迫近美国市场。

sentences.english: The heat, the closeness of the herd, was suddenly overwhelming.
sentences.chinese: 闷热，兽群的骚动和迫近，突然压得他喘不过气来。

sentences.english: What do you do when the deadline looms?
sentences.chinese: 当最后时限迫近的时候你会怎么做？

sentences.english: The dangers posed by the imminent Greek default are all to do with how it happens.
sentences.chinese: 迫近的希腊债务拖欠所产生的危险是该怎么办。

definition: to reduce/to decrease/to shrink
to go smoothly/to come off/to succeed
to counterattack/to come back after a defeat/to retrieve lost ground
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
(military) offensive
dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
to press on towards/to close in on/to approach/to draw near
score
to pull open/to pull apart/to space out/to increase
to catch up vigorously/to set off in hot pursuit
to pursue closely
to return a compliment/to give sth in return
final segment/last stage
to become caught up in an irresolvable situation (idiom)
to withstand/to stand up to
somewhat/to some degree
